complex

Class Complex

  • java.lang.Object
    • complex.Complex

  • public final class Complex
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple Complex-number representation allowing for basic mathematical operations in the complex plane.
    Since:
    2013-11-15
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jimmy Holm

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Complex()
      Default constructor, setting the complex number to 0+0i.
      Complex(Complex Z)
      Copy constructor
      Complex(double a, double b)
      Constructor for a Complex number of type a+bi.

      • Conjugate

        public static Complex Conjugate(Complex Z)
        Create the complex conjugate of a complex number Z.
        Parameters:
        Z - the complex number which conjugate we wish to create.
        Returns:
        The conjugate of Z, so that if Z = a+bi the returned conjugate C = a-bi

      • Add

        public static Complex Add(Complex Z1,
          Complex Z2)
        Create a complex number as the sum of two given complex numbers.
        Parameters:
        Z1 - The first of the two complex numbers to add together.
        Z2 - The second of the two complex numbers to add together.
        Returns:
        The new complex number Z3 so that Z3 = Z1+Z2

      • Add

        public void Add(Complex Z)
        Update this complex number as the addition between this and Z.
        Parameters:
        Z - the complex number to add to this number.

          Complex Z2)
        Create a complex number as the difference of two given complex numbers
        Parameters:
        Z1 - The complex numbers to subtract from
        Z2 - The complex number that is to be subtracted.
        Returns:
        The new complex number Z3 so that Z3 = Z1-Z2

      • Sub

        public void Sub(Complex Z)
        Update this complex number as the subtraction of Z from this.

        Z - The complex number to be subtracted

      • Mul

        public static Complex Mul(Complex Z1,
          Complex Z2)
        Create a complex number as the product of two given complex numbers
        Parameters:
        Z1 - The first of the two complex numbers to multiply together
        Z2 - The second of the two complex numbers to multiply together
        Returns:

      • Mul

        public void Mul(Complex Z)
        Update this complex number to the product of multiplication with Z
        Parameters:

      • Div

        public static Complex Div(Complex Z1,
          Complex Z2)
        Create a new complex number as the quotient of a division of the two complex numbers.
        Parameters:
        Z1 - The numerator of the division
        Z2 - The denominator of the division.
        Returns:
        The new complex number Z3 so that Z3 = Z1÷Z2
        Throws:
        Throws - IllegalArgumentException if |Z2| = 0.

      • Div

        public void Div(Complex Z)
        Update this complex number to be the quotient of division by Z.
        Parameters:
        Z - The denominator in the division.
        Throws:
        Throws - IllegalArgumentException if |Z| = 0.

        Calculate the magnitude (absolute value) of the given complex number.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The absolute value of Z (|Z|)

      • Abs2

        public static double Abs2(Complex Z)
        Calculate the squared magnitude of Z
        Parameters:
        Z - the complex number whose squared magnitude is to be calculated.
        Returns:
        The squared magnitude of Z (|Z|²)

      • Sqrt

        public static Complex Sqrt(Complex Z)
        Calculate the square root of the given complex number.
        Parameters:
        Z - the complex number whose square root we're interested in.
        Returns:
        The square root of the complex number Z.

      • Pow

        public static Complex Pow(Complex Z,
          int n)
        Return the complex number that represents Z to the nth power.
        Parameters:
        Z - The complex number to be raised
        n - The exponent of the new complex number
        Returns:
        An approximation of the complex number Z3 so that Z3 = (Z)^n

      • Pow

        public void Pow(int n)
        Update this complex number to be the approximate result of raising it to the nth power
        Parameters:
        n - the exponent to raise this complex number by.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Provides a textual representation of the complex number in the form a+bi.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string representing the number in the form "Complex(a+bi)".

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Complex Z)
        Compare equality between this and another complex number.
        Parameters:
        Z - The complex number to be compared against.
        Returns:
        true if this and Z refer to the same point in the complex plane.
